title: Doctoral event
description:
This event will facilitate doctoral researchers networking and research dissemination through interactive sessions facilitated by more established researchers in the field. During the event we will have:
  • Roundtable discussions
  • Lightning researcher talks
  • Panel

Joining information has been emailed to registered attendees.

title: CUIs as Entertainers
description:
This SIG will feature practical demonstrations of tools that allow us to use CUIs as entertainers such as large language models like GPT-3, Hidden Markov Models like those used by Botnik’s Voicebox keyboards, and the voice puppetry technology made by CereProc. This event will introduce these tools to participants and give everyone a chance to play around with them on their own, showcasing the creative and entertaining outputs they leverage from CUIs.

Joining information has been emailed to registered attendees.
chairs: Justin Edwards, Leigh Clark, Matthew Aylett, and Allison Perrone

title: Welcome Reception
description: The city of Glasgow are offering a welcome reception at the Glasgow City Chambers to CUI attendees, family and friends; where we will be welcomed by on the cities bailies.

title: Welcome and Keynote 1
description: The CUI 2022 General Chairs will open the conference before introducing the first conference keynote.
chairs: Martin Halvey, Mary Ellen Foster and Jeff Dalton (CUI 2022 General Chairs)

title: Conference Dinner
description: A Glasgow landmark, Sloans is situated in Glasgow’s City Centre and is a short walk from the conference venue. Set over 3 floors, we will be based on one floor for a 3 course meal with drinks followed by a traditional Scottish ceilidh.

title: Town Hall and Keynote 2
description: We will have a Town Hall chaired by the CUI Steering Committee, discussing the future of the conference series and CUI 2023. Following this, we will have the second conference keynote.
